text: Nicholas Robert Moore (born December 9, 1992) is an American football long snapper for the Baltimore Ravens of the National Football League (NFL). ==Baseball career== Moore spent four seasons in the minor league system of the Boston Red Sox after being drafted in the 30th round of the 2011 MLB draft out of high school. He primarily played for the Lowell Spinners at first base and third base. ==College career== Moore played college football at Georgia, where he was recruited to play linebacker and also played fullback. He switched to long snapper in 2017. He competed in 23 games over his Bulldogs career, including 14 as a senior in 2018. ==Professional career== Moore went undrafted during the 2019 NFL Draft. Moore signed with the New Orleans Saints as an undrafted Free Agent on April 28, 2019. Moore was waived on August 21, 2019 for roster cuts. Moore signed with the Tampa Bay Vipers of the XFL after being drafted in Phase 5 of the 2020 XFL Draft. He had his contract terminated when the league suspended operations on April 10, 2020. He signed with the Baltimore Ravens on March 26, 2020. He was waived on September 5, 2020, and re-signed to the Ravens' practice squad the next day. ==References== ==External links== *Georgia Bulldogs bio Category:1992 births Category:Living people Category:American football long snappers Category:Georgia Bulldogs football players Category:Tampa Bay Vipers players Category:Baltimore Ravens players Category:Lowell Spinners players Category:Gulf Coast Red Sox players Category:Greenville Drive players Category:Salem Red Sox players
title: Nick Moore (American football)
